topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5598db9e6368727d0e0002d1#post_5598db9e6368727d0e0002d1
 your situation with your step dad is a lot Like how I felt when my grandmother lived with us
She was just so unbearable that me,  my mom and my grandpa would just kinda go in our rooms and rot all day.  Honestly going home from a shopping trip was always kinda terrible. 

And I'm in the same boat on the plan for a GED. _maybe_ some college afterward but I honestly don't know what I'd do. 

"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5598dba66368727d0e0002d5#post_5598dba66368727d0e0002d5
I only got up to defender

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5598df896368724364000032#post_5598df896368724364000032
that really does sound the same.

Me, My Brother, And My sister would usually just stay in our rooms all day cuz we just didn't feel like dealing with him. He was always Drunk. Loud. And would play music super loud.

Plus invite people over randomly. 

OH! Also He invited his Son over one time for the week. And we went to the store right?

Well his son was "Acting up" and basically he was messing with him.

Do you know. That My Step Dad, At The Exit door, WITH PEOPLE WATCHING. *SLAPPED HIS KID UPSIDE THE FACE.*

The Register lady literally Gasped! Needless to say we never went there again because of that shit. 

We were too embarrassed. 


Also I was thinking maybe after my GED I'd go to college for art. But at the same time I know Art school can be pretty intense.
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5
